item.title: Review - N.Ferguson’s War of the world
item.description: Having just completed the excellent study of the past century in war, ‘The War of the World’ by Niall Ferguson, I though I’d jot down a few notes as much for my own recollection (of the 600+ pager) as well as for those interested. Let me start with a few broad strokes to try and summarize some of the book’s findings: Ferguson lists three ingredients as key predictive indicators of the descent of societies into genocide and brutal conflict of the type seen over and again throughout the past century (and more recently in Yugoslavia and Rwanda).
